org.threadly.concurrent.limiter

Class SubmitterSchedulerQueueLimitRejector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.AbstractSubmitterExecutor
      • org.threadly.concurrent.AbstractSubmitterScheduler
        • org.threadly.concurrent.wrapper.limiter.SubmitterSchedulerQueueLimitRejector
          • org.threadly.concurrent.limiter.SubmitterSchedulerQueueLimitRejector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, SimpleSchedulerInterface, SubmitterExecutor, SubmitterExecutorInterface, SubmitterScheduler, SubmitterSchedulerInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SchedulerServiceQueueLimitRejector
    Deprecated. 
    Replaced by SubmitterSchedulerQueueLimitRejector

    @Deprecated
public class SubmitterSchedulerQueueLimitRejector
extends SubmitterSchedulerQueueLimitRejector

    A simple way to limit any SubmitterScheduler so that queues are managed. In addition this queue is tracked completely independent of the SubmitterScheduler's actual queue, so these can be distributed in code to limit queues differently to different parts of the system, while letting them all back the same SubmitterScheduler.

    Once the limit has been reached, if additional tasks are supplied a RejectedExecutionException will be thrown. This is the threadly equivalent of supplying a limited sized blocking queue to a java.util.concurrent thread pool.

    See ExecutorQueueLimitRejector and SchedulerServiceQueueLimitRejector as other possible implementations.

    Since:
    4.3.0
